channel.description: Recent content in reference on Forest Garden Wales

item.title: Recommended
item.author: hello@growdigital.org (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Books Creating a Forest Garden by Martin Crawford A New Garden Ethic by Benjamin Vogt, the morality of gardening with natives The Wild Garden, by Violet Stevenson, 1985 but pretty much the only book covering the use of UK native plants Around the world in 80 plants by Stephen Barstow, a global romp around edible plants The Garden of Equal Delights by Anni Kelsey, forest gardening from the gardener’s perspective, delightful and intriguing Suppliers Backyard Larder, Alison Tindale Incredible Veg, Mandy Barber Agroforestry Research Trust, Martin Crawford Cool Temperate, Phil Corbett Future Forests, for hedging Websites Plants For A Future brilliant database of useful plants, essential Database of Insects & their Food intoxifying amount of info about which plants are hosts for which insects orangepippin.

item.title: Spacing
item.author: hello@growdigital.org (Jake Rayson)
item.description: It’s important to leave enough space between trees in the canopy layer, so that there’s enough light coming through to the plants below.

item.title: Tree spacing in the forest garden
item.author: hello@growdigital.org (Jake Rayson)
item.description: It’s important to leave enough space between trees in the canopy layer, so that there’s enough light coming through to the plants below.
